messageBody:
Mitch Christensen wrote:

> I think the answer is to refactor the private method to support some
> form of dependency injection so I can insert mock objects that eliminate
> the exception.

That's what I would do.

> My question was whether they may be a better/more efficient approach?

It depends what your goal is. If your goal is to get the test running
now, then yes; if your goal is to learn a strategy for dealing with this
problem whenever it pops up, then I don't think so.

Good luck.
